description.narrative: The World Health Organisation Western Pacific regional Office (WPRO) reform strategy aims strengthen effective leadership at country level to assist countries achieve their health development goals. This initiative will provide a clear framework through which WHO can enhance its performance and develop more effective leadership and encompass a three-phased approach: developing the right direction; moving forward; and making a difference. Australian support will support: part of the development and implementation of the Strategy; scale up of staff training on effective policy dialogue and strategic communications; the expanded roll out of a learning program on national health policy, strategy and plans; senior management leadership and technical skill set needs and steps for achieving this skill set; development regional communications strategy; country needs assessments; and development of monitoring and evaluation practices. The total value of this initiative is $2.3 million to be exp
